Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of probably Clazomenian pottery neck-amphora; exterior: glazed black on neck with band of added red on moulded ridge at junction of neck and shoulder; on shoulder, painted decoration consisting of three rows of scales with single dot in added white in the centre of each scale; at far left, part of black handle zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Cook states that although the scales are typical of Clazomenian black figure pottery, they are not exclusive to Clazomenian pottery and therefore, the origin of this specific sherd cannot be confirmed although Clazomenian scales tend to be long (Cook 1952, 143, n. 102, no. 7). For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see Brussels A.1797.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 11-2, no. 30, pl. 2, no. 30)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 143 note 102, o. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.126) (phase 3)
